parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It discusses hybrid warfare tactics employed by Russia, citing a NATO official's interview. There is no mention of any Romanian political party or candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group. The reach estimate is ">1M".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to inform the public about a geopolitical issue (Russia's hybrid warfare tactics) based on an interview with a NATO official. While the topic is political, there is no discernible attempt to influence voters' choices in the upcoming parliamentary elections. The content focuses on international relations and security, not on domestic electoral politics.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information from an interview with a NATO official, which aligns with journalistic practices of reporting on current events. The link directs to an article on panorama.ro, further suggesting a journalistic approach to disseminating information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; it reports on an interview with a NATO official, presenting the official's views on a geopolitical issue. There is no subjective interpretation or personal bias evident in the content.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1081578163661756</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while political in nature, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on a geopolitical analysis of Russia's hybrid warfare, citing a NATO official. It does not mention any Romanian parliamentary candidates or parties, nor does it attempt to influence voters' choices in the election. The content is presented in a journalistic style, reporting on an interview and providing a link to a related article.  The paid advertisement format on Facebook does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda; the content itself must meet the criteria outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, which this post does not.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>NEWBIZ ONLINE PUBLISHING S.R.L.</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
